definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
to pour liquid/to irrigate (using waterwheel)/to water/to cast (molten metal)/to mold

sentences.english: The acting career plummeted suddenly, he relied on alcohol to release.
sentences.chinese: 演艺事业突然一落千丈，他便借酒浇愁。

sentences.english: Some people like to drown their troubles in drink.
Gu Kexin at home every day to drink it.
sentences.chinese: 顾可馨便每天在家借酒浇愁。

sentences.english: Their frequent quarrelling drove him to drink.
sentences.chinese: 他们之间的经常争吵迫使他借酒浇愁。

sentences.english: John is in the bar drowning his sorrows.
sentences.chinese: 约翰在酒吧里借酒浇愁。

sentences.english: She spends the whole date obsessing about Ross and Julie, and drinking too much wine.
sentences.chinese: 但整个晚上她都在为罗斯和朱丽的事伤心，借酒浇愁。

sentences.english: His show biz suddenly drop, so he abreact depend on alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 演艺事业突然一落千丈，他便借酒浇愁。

sentences.english: Sarah: I hope you get her back before you need to.
sentences.chinese: 希望你借酒浇愁前能找回她。

sentences.english: It is understandable that certain situations might drive anyone to drink.
sentences.chinese: 有的情况会使人借酒浇愁，这是不难理解的。

sentences.english: I've got a bottle of whiskey here - shall we drown our sorrows?
sentences.chinese: 我这儿有瓶威士忌，咱们一醉方休借酒浇愁怎么样？

sentences.english: He drowned his sorrows in drink all day after his wife died.
sentences.chinese: 在妻子去世后，他整天借酒浇愁。

sentences.english: Since Emperor Tang does not return to the palace, beauty Yang becomes angry and drinks her sorrows away.
sentences.chinese: 杨贵妃因唐明皇夜不回宫，心底生怨，借酒浇愁。

sentences.english: The more depressed he get, the more he turn to drink.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪越低落越是借酒浇愁。

sentences.english: Last night I saw him crying in his beer.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上我看到他在借酒浇愁。

sentences.english: That man turned_to_drinking to forget his problems.
sentences.chinese: 那个人借酒浇愁，想忘掉自己的问题。

sentences.english: When his wife left him he had to recur to drinking.
sentences.chinese: 当妻子离他而去时他只好借酒浇愁。

definition: dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
lit. as drunk as mud/completely drunk
to love wine as one's life (idiom); fond of the bottle
to get thoroughly drunk (idiom)/to get plastered
as if drunk or entranced (idiom); leading a befuddled existence/in a drunken stupor
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
